metadata.Title: CVE-2021-30499 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in libcaca. A buffer overflow of export.c in functionexport_troff might lead to memory corruption and other potentialconsequences.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-30499` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

caca-utils - 0.99.beta18-1ubuntu5.1+esm2
libcaca0 - 0.99.beta18-1ubuntu5.1+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libcaca package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.99.beta18-1ubuntu5.1+esm2').
